title: Building mode

properties.name: description
properties.value: Building mode is used when players want to access their player-owned house to start constructing rooms, building furniture, etc. This feature can be accessed from the Options menu in the main game interface. Once "House options" button is chosen, players can toggle Building mode ON and OFF.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Building mode

Building mode is used when players want to access their player-owned house to start constructing rooms, building furniture, etc. This feature can be accessed from the Options menu in the main game interface. Once "House options" button is chosen, players can toggle Building mode ON and OFF.

When building in OFF mode, house owners can invite friends to visit their houses. Anyone visiting the house will only see furnitures that have already been built. Owners can host parties, duel with others, and serve tea while in this mode. By default, building mode is set to OFF. Pets are not allowed to be out in building mode. Random events do not appear in houses in building mode.

However, when building in ON mode, only the owner of the house is able to enter. Other players will be prohibited from entering the house. While in this mode, vacant hotspots appear as ghostly figures of the lowest piece of furniture that can be built there. House owners can also build additional rooms (such as Quest Hall and Portal Chamber) and gardens, by clicking on the door hotspot that becomes available as rooms are created. It should be noted that items from the inventory cannot be dropped while building mode is ON.

As of 30 July 2015, players can call their servant. This can be helpful when power-training Construction.

Gallery[edit | edit source]

  • A starter house currently in Building mode.

  • The House options can be found within the Options interface.

  • Building mode is currently ON.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
8 May 2014
(update)

Random events that take you to another location should no longer occur in building mode, this doesn't include those that teleport you away for failing to complete the event.
rawContent:
{{External|rs}}
'''Building mode''' is used when players want to access their [[player-owned house]] to start constructing rooms, building furniture, etc. This feature can be accessed from the [[Options]] menu in the main game [[interface]]. Once "House options" button is chosen, players can toggle Building mode ON and OFF.

When building in OFF mode, house owners can invite friends to visit their houses. Anyone visiting the house will only see [[furniture]]s that have already been built. Owners can host parties, duel with others, and serve [[Cup of tea|tea]] while in this mode. By default, building mode is set to OFF. Pets are not allowed to be out in building mode. [[Random events]] do not appear in houses in building mode.

However, when building in ON mode, only the owner of the house is able to enter. Other players will be prohibited from entering the house. While in this mode, vacant [[hotspot]]s appear as ghostly figures of the lowest piece of furniture that can be built there. House owners can also build additional rooms (such as [[Quest Hall]] and [[Portal Chamber]]) and [[garden]]s, by clicking on the [[door hotspot]] that becomes available as rooms are created. It should be noted that items from the inventory '''cannot''' be dropped while building mode is ON.

As of [[Update:Custom F-Keys & Music Cape|30 July 2015]], players can call their [[servant]]. This can be helpful when power-training [[Construction]].

==Gallery==
<gallery>
Building mode.png|A starter house currently in Building mode.
Display option interface.png|The [[Options#House options|House options]] can be found within the [[Options]] interface.
House Options interface.png|Building mode is currently ON.
</gallery>

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 8 May 2014
|update = Your banks, it has tabs!
|change = Random events that take you to another location should no longer occur in building mode, this doesn't include those that teleport you away for failing to complete the event.
}}
